intro: Omphalotheca, commonly known as the "navelwort," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Omphalotheca species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its botanical features include a distinct umbel-like inflorescence and a root system that can form dense colonies.
